issue.title: Error reporting for recursive_directory_iterator::pop() is under-specified

discussion.p: Unlike increment, pop() does not specify how it reports errors nor does it provide a std::error_code overload. However implementing pop() all but requires performing an increment, so it should handle errors in the same way.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4582.

li.p: Change , class recursive_directory_iterator synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.p:
-30- Requires: *this != recursive_directory_iterator().
-31- Effects: If depth() == 0, set *this to recursive_directory_iterator(). Otherwise, cease iteration of the directory currently being iterated over, and continue iteration over the parent directory.
-?- Throws: As specified in Error reporting ().
